metadata.Title: CVE-2018-10995 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
SchedMD Slurm before 17.02.11 and 17.1x.x before 17.11.7 mishandles user names (aka user_name fields) and group ids (aka gid fields). It was discovered that SLurm mishandles user names and group ids. A local attacker could use this to gain administrative privileges.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-10995` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpam-slurm - 2.6.5-1ubuntu0.1~esm4
libpmi0 - 2.6.5-1ubuntu0.1~esm4
libslurm-perl - 2.6.5-1ubuntu0.1~esm4
libslurm26 - 2.6.5-1ubuntu0.1~esm4
libslurmdb-perl - 2.6.5-1ubuntu0.1~esm4
libslurmdb26 - 2.6.5-1ubuntu0.1~esm4
slurm-llnl - 2.6.5-1ubuntu0.1~esm4
slurm-llnl-basic-plugins - 2.6.5-1ubuntu0.1~esm4
slurm-llnl-slurmdbd - 2.6.5-1ubuntu0.1~esm4
slurm-llnl-sview - 2.6.5-1ubuntu0.1~esm4
slurm-llnl-torque - 2.6.5-1ubuntu0.1~esm4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: slurm-llnl package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.6.5-1ubuntu0.1~esm4').
